title: BASF 's planned capital expenditure by region 2020 to 2024
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of capital expenditure for 5 number of Regions.
Region Asia Pacific has the highest Share of capital expenditure and South America Africa Middle East has the lowest Share of capital expenditure.
The difference of Share of capital expenditure between the highest and lowest Region is 40.0.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Share of capital expenditure in the y axis.
The maximum Share of capital expenditure 41.0 is found at Region Asia Pacific and the minimum is found at South America Africa Middle East where Region is 1.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of capital expenditure for 5 number of Regions.
Region Asia Pacific has the highest Share of capital expenditure and South America Africa Middle East has the lowest Share of capital expenditure.
The difference of Share of capital expenditure between the highest and lowest Region is 40.0.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Share of capital expenditure in each Region on the y axis.
The Share of capital expenditure is appeared to be the highest at Region Asia Pacific and lowest at Region South America Africa Middle East.
The difference of Share of capital expenditure between the highest and lowest Region is 40.0.
Region Asia Pacific is higher than any other Regions with value 41.0, followed by Europe, and North America. Down to Region South America Africa Middle East with the lowest value 1.0.
The Region Asia Pacific has 2.05 times more Share of capital expenditure than average.
Summing up the values of all Regions, we get total 100.0.
